title: Kerala to prepare oil spill crisis management plan
content: The Ministry of Defence has directed the State to notify the plan.  PCB chairperson says a Bengaluru-based agency has been selected to prepare the plan. The agency will first study the characteristics of the K

title: Moolamattom power plant to be shut down for a  month for maintenance
content: Clearing the leakage of the butterfly valve and repairing the two main inlet valves of the powerhouse will be taken up. To complete the repair works, the powerhouse will be shut down from  November 11 to December 10

title: Yathindra says his father will complete full term ‘under present circumstances’
content: Yathindra dismissed the rumours about ‘November revolution’ and said there is no discussion on the issue in the party

title: Assam government faces criticism over plan to table report on 1983 Nellie massacre
content: More than 2,000 people were killed in the Nellie incident, which occurred on February 18, 1983, during the peak of the anti-foreigners Assam Agitation; the victims were migrant Muslims, mostly women and children.

title: 75,000 more medical seats to be added at UG/PG level in next five years: Union Health Minister
content: Union Minister J.P. Nadda was addressing the 50th annual convocation ceremony of All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Delhi; he urged the graduating students to actively contribute to academics and research

content: Asks authorities to maintain high vigil along the coast in the constituency to minimise loss of lives and property following cyclone alerts issued by IMD

title: Settle Aarogyasri dues to network hospitals and restore medical services, CPI tells Andhra Pradesh government

content: AAP MLA from Doda said those pretending to be "anti-BJP are the same ones proving their friendship with Sat Sharma".

title: UDF accuses Kochi Mayor of insulting city by not turning up to receive President as per protocol
content: As the first citizen of Kochi and in accordance with protocol, the Mayor should have received the President in his official gown, says UDF

title: Kufos to set up Marine Biology Centre at Kavaratti
content: The new centre will host state-of-the-art laboratories for marine genomics, coral restoration, and blue biotechnology, along with coastal and offshore field research stations

title: CPI uncompromisingly demands “review or withdrawal” of controversial PM SHRI accord
content: The Central-State accord on PM SHRI funding implied an acceptance of the National Education Policy, says D. Raja

title: Air quality remains 'poor' in Haryana, Punjab
content: The Air Quality Index (AQI) in Haryana's Fatehabad was 329 at 4 p.m., according to the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) data

title: Key suspect in Sirkazhi double murder arrested in Rajasthan after 3 years
content: In a significant breakthrough in the 2021 Sirkazhi double murder case, police arrested key suspect J. Ramesh Patel in Rajasthan on October 24, after a three-year manhunt. The arrest marks the conclusion of a violent episode that left jeweller Dhanraj Choudhary’s wife Asha and son Akhil dead, and resulted in a theft of gold and cash valued at approximately ₹4.62 crore.

title: Firm ordered to pay compensation, refund for alleged failure to honour holiday membership
content: The Commission found Maharashtra-based firm’s persistent refusal to provide accommodation on the stock plea of ‘peak period’ and denial of refund despite cancellation requests as a deficiency in service and unfair trade practice

title: Tejashwi Yadav yet to come out of our father's shadow, says brother Tej Pratap
content: The Janshakti Janata Dal leader exuded confidence that he faced "no contest" in Mahua, where he claims credit for the establishment of a medical college

title: Post Kurnool tragedy, Karnataka to mandate extra emergency doors and fire extinguishers in buses
content: Currently, most premium and sleeper buses are fully enclosed, with only two main doors, one near the driver’s seat and another for passengers

title: Disagreement over cleaning up waterbodies beneath railway culverts hits flood mitigation in Kochi
content: While the local bodies and related agencies concerned insist that the responsibility lies with the Railways, the Railways, in turn, place the onus on the former

title: Kurnool fire tragedy: bus hit the bike lying on road after another accident, say police
content: Police question the survivor who was pillion riding the bike; the bus hit the bike lying on the road after the later hit a road divider, leading to the fire

title: KC(M) sides with CPI(M) amid turmoil over PM SHRI in LDF
content: The KC(M)’s position is widely seen as an act of reciprocity towards the CPI(M), which has stood by the party in several crises. The Chief Minister, in particular, has taken a keen interest in advancing the KC(M)’s pro-farmer agenda through legislations.

title: Cyclone Montha: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu asks officials to stay alert
content: With the Meteorological Department issuing a red alert, the Chief Minister asks officials to take steps to prevent loss of lives and damage to properties; he also orders that water levels in all the major and minor reservoirs be monitored continuously

title: Retired Customs official joins Congress
content: A native of Balada village in Kotturu mandal, Kuna Ramrarao worked in the Central government office for the last 30 years in various cities

title: Kerala govt. sanctions ₹50 crore to Supplyco for market intervention in the run-up to Christmas-New Year season
content: The amount of ₹50 crore is over and above the Budget allocation earmarked for Supplyco for market intervention.

title: Dampa byelection: Complaint filed against Mizoram CM, adviser over poll code violation
content: The party has also filed a complaint against ruling Zoram People’s Movement (ZPM) MLA and adviser to the Chief Minister Dr. Lorrain Lalpekliana Chinzah

title: India’s largest hydropower project undergoes test run
content: Work on NHPC’s 2,000 MW Subansiri Lower Hydroelectric Project, straddling the Arunachal Pradesh-Assam border, was suspended between 2011 and 2019 due to protests

title: In a Bengal village, urban and rural children meet over art
content: They worked together on the sign of infinity — on one half of the horizontal ‘8’ the village students painted their imagination of a city, and on the other half the city students created their impression of a village

title: J&K Rajya Sabha polls: Farooq Abdullah, BJP reject allegations of 'fixed match'
content: On Friday (October 24), the ruling National Conference won three seats, while the BJP managed one in the first Rajya Sabha elections

title: A sullied haven at Suchindram
content: Tamil Nadu, with its rich biodiversity, is a haven for animals, birds, and fishes. The State’s concerted efforts to preserve and protect it have been acknowledged internationally. However, anthropogenic activity on the edges of pristine natural beauty hangs like a Damocles’ sword, threatening the biodiversity itself. In one such case, B. Kolappan and Shankari Nivethitha B. find that Suchindram lake, a waterbody that attracts migratory birds and a Ramsar site in Kanniyakumari district in south Tamil Nadu, is being threatened by human activity

title: Rendering justice is a profoundly human effort, technology can only be a powerful ally: Justice Kant
content: AI may assist in researching authorities, generating drafts, or highlighting inconsistencies, but it ‘cannot perceive the tremor in a witness’s voice, the anguish behind a petition, or the moral weight of a decision’, Justice Surya Kant said in a keynote address

title: Tiger attacks woman in Uttar Pradesh’s Katarniaghat Wildlife Sanctuary
content: The incident triggered anger among the villagers, who staged a protest, accusing the forest officials of arriving late

title: Kurnool bus tragedy: APFSL begins DNA matching of 18 bodies
content: As the many bodies were almost reduced to ashes in the mishap, we have collected bones of all the deceased from the burnt bus, APFSL Director G. Pala Raju said

content: This Assembly election will decide whether the 'jungle raaj' will return to Bihar or the State remains on the path of development

title: DGCA to review power bank fire incident onboard flight: Naidu
content: On October 19, a passenger's power bank caught fire on board a Dimapur-bound IndiGo plane while taxiing at the Delhi airport, and the fire was extinguished by the cabin crew

title: Private bus overturns near Peda Amberpet, eight injured
content: The bus, belonging to NEU GO Travels, was allegedly driven negligently until it lost control and rammed into a central divider

title: 26-year-old dies in accident on poorly-maintained road in Bengaluru; sparks outrage
content: The victim, a private firm employee, died after the scooter — on which she was riding pillion — reportedly skidded on a poorly maintained road

content: After resisting the NEP 2020 for long, Kerala has now agreed to join the PM SHRI scheme. Let’s get into what prompted the U-turn, the controversy, and what it means for the State’s schools

content: Given the current day’s crisis of neoliberal capitalism and suppression of freedom worldwide, the need for collective action and socialist transformation was urgent, he said

content: When asked whether the SIT had confiscated the “missing gold” from Bengaluru, Devaswom Board Minister V.N. Vasavan said the “investigation was on the right track”

title: Luka sets Lakers mark with 92 points to open year
content: Luka Doncic continued his torrid start to the season, scoring 49 points in a 128-110 win over the Timberwolves to give him a franchise-record 92 points through the first two games.

title: Sources: Falcons highly likely to start Cousins
content: Kirk Cousins is "highly likely" to be the Falcons' starting quarterback against the Dolphins, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter, as Michael Penix Jr. deals with a bone bruise in his left knee.

title: Jays use 9-run 6th to bury L.A. in statement win
content: The Blue Jays showed they are a powerhouse in their own right Friday night, putting Game 1 of the World Series away with a nine-run sixth inning and beating the Dodgers 11-4.

title: Mavs 0-2 as 'Fire Nico!' chants grow loud again
content: Many Mavericks fans vented their frustration by again chanting "Fire Nico!" as the final minute played out in a 117-107 loss to the Wizards that dropped Dallas to 0-2 on the season.

title: Jays fans hit Ohtani with 'don't need you' chants
content: Blue Jays fans let Shohei Ohtani hear it before and during Game 1 of the World Series, their disapproval of him not picking their team in free agency in 2023 clearly still evident.

title: No. 7 Georgia Tech down 3 starters vs. Syracuse
content: No. 7 Georgia Tech will be without three starters -- wide receiver Malik Rutherford, center Harrison Moore and nickelback Jy Gilmore -- against Syracuse.

title: Blazers move forward, win day after Billups' arrest
content: Led by interim coach Tiago Splitter, the Trail Blazers began moving forward after the arrest of coach Chauncey Billups, earning a 139-119 win over the Warriors.

title: KD sees positives to Rockets' reaction to 0-2 start
content: Kevin Durant says Rockets players and coaches are "pissed off" as they fell to 0-2 with a 115-111 loss to the Pistons but also views that early-season frustration as a good thing.

content: When Real Madrid and Barcelona face off, there's nothing bigger happening anywhere in the soccer world.

content: The surprising loss to Portugal by the U.S. women's national team came from players who admit they were "on islands" and "trying to fix it on their own."

content: Oscar Piastri has confirmed that he and McLaren teammate Lando Norris are starting from a "clean slate" at the Mexican Grand Prix after the Australian took responsibility for their collision at the U.S. Grand Prix.

content: From three transfers on the first team to four freshmen on the second, here are Jay Bilas' All-America teams.

title: Steelers' 1933 striped throwbacks, Chargers' navy look top NFL Week 8 uniforms
content: It's the debut of a throwback uniform for the Steelers in Week 8, while the Eagles will also be wearing kelly green.

title: NFL Week 8's fashionable arrivals, featuring Justin Jefferson
content: From suits to streetwear, Week 8's arrivals mixed personal flair and cold-weather layers with comfort and creativity.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United optimistic over Hjulmand deal
content: Manchester United are optimistic they can secure a deal to sign Sporting CP midfielder Morten Hjulmand. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: 'You can call me Raja': Indian-origin Congressman shuts down 'racist' Florida leader
content: Chandler Langevin is a member of the Palm Bay City Council who made headlines because of his hateful statements against Indians. He said Indians in America only care for benefiting their countries and hence they should be ousted. This led to a massive controversy and the city council voted for the elimination of Langevin from the council.

title: 'Gharwale bhi bol rahe hai ...' - Why Gill gave this reply during PC
content: India's 18-match ODI toss losing streak continued as Australia won the toss and batted first. Captain Gill light-heartedly addressed the streak, emphasising the team's confident, no-pressure environment. He also praised Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's match-winning partnership in India's nine-wicket victory.

title: Trade, Xi & Kim: Trump starts Asia tour; what's on the agenda
content: President Trump begins his first Asia tour of his second term, visiting Malaysia, Japan, and South Korea. The trip aims to restore economic balance and reaffirm US influence, with key meetings planned with Chinese President Xi Jinping and potentially North Korean leader Kim Jong Un.  The tour includes trade negotiations, peace accords, and investment commitments.

title: Cognizant hiring: CEO says Arts graduates wanted not CS; here's his reason why
content: Cognizant CEO Ravi Kumar S announces the IT firm is hiring more school graduates than ever in 2025, actively recruiting liberal arts majors from community colleges alongside traditional STEM candidates. Kumar tells Fortune that AI creates entry-level opportunities by amplifying human potential rather than displacing workers. He advises students to focus on interdisciplinary skills, combining fields like history with computational abilities. The CEO emphasizes that as AI makes expertise accessible, applying intelligence becomes more valuable than specialisation, with faster paths to expertise for graduates who leverage AI tools effectively.

title: 'True legend': PM Modi mourns veteran actor Satish Shah; hails 'iconic wit'
content: Veteran actor Satish Shah, a legend of Indian entertainment, has passed away at 74. Known for his iconic roles in films like 'Jaane Bhi Do Yaaro' and the beloved TV show 'Sarabhai vs Sarabhai', Shah brought laughter to millions with his impeccable comic timing and versatility.

title: Jharkhand shock: 7-yr-old tests HIV+, kin blame blood bank; probe underway
content: A seven-year-old thalassemia patient in Jharkhand has tested HIV-positive, leading to an investigation into allegations of contaminated blood transfusion from the local blood bank. A five-member team from Ranchi is probing the incident, examining blood donors and the blood bank's procedures. While the family suspects the blood bank, authorities caution against premature conclusions, noting other potential infection routes.

title: BCCI breaks silence after Australia Women cricketers molested in Indore
content: Two Australian cricketers faced inappropriate behaviour in Indore, prompting a strong condemnation from the BCCI. The accused motorcyclist was swiftly arrested by local police. The BCCI Secretary emphasized India's hospitality and zero tolerance for such acts, assuring a review of safety protocols to protect visiting teams. The incident occurred near the players' hotel.

title: ‘Patently excessive’: JP Morgan fumes as it foots $60 m bill for founder; calls fees ‘abuse’
content: JPMorgan Chase is reportedly seeking to end its obligation to pay legal fees for Charlie Javice, the founder of Frank, who was found guilty of defrauding the bank. Despite a contract clause, JPMorgan argues the $60.1 million already advanced for her defense and appeal is "patently excessive and egregious," citing multiple law firms and high hourly rates.

title: MP shocker: 2 Australian cricketers stalked, molested in Indore
content: Two Australian cricketers were allegedly followed and molested by a man in Indore while returning to their hotel. The incident occurred on Thursday morning, prompting the team's security manager to file a complaint. Police have identified and booked a suspect following a CCTV footage review.

title: Veteran actor Satish Shah passes away due to kidney failure at 74
content: Veteran actor Satish Shah, celebrated for his iconic roles in 'Sarabhai Vs Sarabhai' and films like 'Jaane Bhi Do Yaar', has passed away at 74. The beloved performer succumbed to kidney-related issues after being admitted to Hinduja hospital. Filmmaker Ashoke Pandit confirmed the tragic news, mourning a significant loss to the Indian entertainment industry.

title: Vintage Ro-Ko at SCG! India crush Australia by 9 wickets in style
content: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli delivered a vintage performance at the SCG, guiding India to a nine-wicket victory in the third ODI against Australia. Sharma notched his 50th international century with an unbeaten 121, while Kohli remained 74 not out. Their unbroken 168-run partnership secured the win, potentially marking a memorable farewell for the legends Down Under.

title: ‘Not robust enough’: Airbnb CEO says ChatGPT can’t yet power platform; hints at future use
content: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky expressed interest in integrating OpenAI's ChatGPT, but found its current SDK insufficient for their needs. While Airbnb already uses AI, the trend favors customizable open-source models, with Chinese tech giants like Alibaba leading the charge by releasing advanced, cost-effective systems and fostering a vast open-source AI ecosystem.

title: Over 12k trains to be run for festival season -check list of trains, routes & more
content: Indian Railways has deployed over 12,075 special trains to manage the festive season rush, particularly around Diwali and Chhath Puja. These services, a 56% increase from last year, aim to ensure safe and timely travel for over 30 lakh passengers, with enhanced amenities at major stations.

title: Bihar polls: Early sunset for Jan Suraaj? 3 key battles facing the 'challenger'
content: Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj party faces significant hurdles in Bihar's upcoming elections. Candidate desertions and worker discontent plague the new political force. Both ruling alliances and opposition accuse Jan Suraaj of being a 'B team,' raising questions about its electoral viability and potential to act as a spoiler.

title: 'Two ducks out of pond': Shastri roasts Kohli for back-to-back noughts in AUS
content: Ravi Shastri took a playful dig at Virat Kohli after he, along with Rohit Sharma led India to a nine-wicket win against Australia in the third ODI.  Despite Australia's early efforts, India's bowlers contained the hosts, enabling the veteran duo to secure a commanding victory. This win provided a significant morale boost for India, concluding the series on a positive note.

title: 'Not going to be easy': Rohit Sharma's honest confession after Sydney ODI win
content: Rohit Sharma's 50th international century and Virat Kohli's unbeaten 74 guided India to a commanding nine-wicket victory in the third ODI against Australia. Despite losing the series 2-1, the duo's stellar partnership ensured India avoided a whitewash, with Sharma also named Player of the Series.

title: Indian-origin trucker crash: Florida moves Supreme Court over immigrant CDLs
content: An Indian-origin truck driver, Harjinder Singh, accused in a fatal Florida crash, reportedly failed his CDL test ten times before obtaining a license. This incident has intensified the debate over issuing commercial licenses to undocumented immigrants, with Florida petitioning the Supreme Court against such policies.

title: Cam Whitmore confirms romance with viral Hollywood singer in steamy IG post
content: Rapper BIA, 34, has publicly confirmed her relationship with 21-year-old NBA player Cam Whitmore through a social media kissing video. The Houston Rockets draftee, now with the Washington Wizards, and the Massachusetts femcee are making headlines for their romance, despite the 13-year age difference. Both appear focused on their respective careers.

title: Brittany Mahomes makes statement in Patrick Mahomes-themed outfit
content: Brittany Mahomes showcased her ultimate NFL WAG style at Arrowhead Stadium, wearing a bold gray-green sweater featuring Patrick Mahomes' face front and back. She paired the eye-catching top with a matching mini skirt and thigh-high boots, accessorizing with luxury items. This fashion statement highlights her devoted game-day spirit and continues her streak of stylish appearances.

title: Delhi prepares for Chhath: With rain over, froth back in Yamuna; pollution rises
content: The aftermath of the monsoon has unveiled troubling pollution levels in Delhi's Yamuna River, with frothing reemerging alongside a troubling spike in faecal coliform and BOD metrics. In a bid to combat this issue, authorities have made efforts to beautify the ghats for Chhath festivities and orchestrated water releases from Haryana. However, environmentalists emphasize that these measures are merely stopgaps.

title: Virat Kohli walks away: Happy ending to a beautiful story
content: India beat Australia by nine wickets to finish the three-match ODI series 2-1. With Rohit Sharma scoring 121, Virat Kohli's unbeaten 74 in his potential final Australian innings secured India's victory, averting a whitewash. The veteran batter, a consistent performer Down Under, leaves a remarkable legacy with numerous centuries and impressive averages across formats, etching unforgettable moments at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

title: Bihar polls: Tejashwi vows state development; calls Nitish 'incapable of leading'
content: Tejashwi Yadav promises to transform Bihar into a leading state by attracting investments and establishing factories. He pledges government jobs for every family within 20 months and Rs 30,000 annually for women. Yadav criticizes the NDA government and vows to bring development to Bihar if the INDIA bloc wins power.

title: IND vs AUS: Only behind Tendulkar! Kohli rewrites record books at SCG
content: Virat Kohli achieved another significant milestone, becoming the second-highest run-scorer in ODI history, surpassing Kumar Sangakkara. He also equaled Sachin Tendulkar's record for most 50+ scores against Australia in ODIs. Kohli's composed half-century anchored India's chase, showcasing his prowess as a "Chasemaster".

title: Satish Shah passes away at 74: Fans pay tribute to 'Dilwale Dulhaniya Le Jayenge' actor
content: Veteran actor Satish Shah, celebrated for his comedic roles in 'Sarabhai Vs Sarabhai' and 'Jaane Bhi Do Yaaro', has passed away at 74. The actor, who had been battling kidney issues, left a lasting legacy in Indian cinema and television. His demise has prompted widespread tributes from fans remembering his memorable performances and the laughter he brought to audiences.

title: Who is Zoe Spencer? Twitch star banned after viral video controversy
content: Twitch streamer Zoe Spencer has been banned from the platform following a viral video showing alleged inappropriate behavior towards FaZe Silky's assistant, Said. The footage, which also features fellow streamer Nina Lin, depicts them reportedly carrying Said to a bed after an incident. Both streamers' accounts were taken down, sparking debate about Twitch's enforcement of community guidelines.

title: 'You two old dogs still have sting in your tail': How Shastri praised Kohli and Rohit
content: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli guided India to a nine-wicket win over Australia in the third ODI. Sharma scored an unbeaten century, while Kohli made a half-century. Their partnership was crucial in chasing the target. Pacer Harshit Rana also performed well with the ball. The win concluded India's series against Australia.

title: Building a home gym? Kareena Kapoor’s fitness trainer recommends these 15 tools
content: Kareena Kapoor Khan's fitness trainer, Mahesh Ghanekar, recommends 15 versatile tools for a home gym, emphasizing flexibility, endurance, and balance. Key equipment includes dumbbells, medicine balls, barbells, and adjustable benches, alongside yoga accessories and a stepper. Proper guidance is advised to prevent injuries while utilizing these items for a comprehensive workout.

title: Planning retirement with Rs 1 crore? Here is how to get Rs 1 lakh per month!
content: Retirees with Rs 1 crore need to carefully plan withdrawals to ensure their savings last. The 4% rule is a common guideline, but higher returns can allow for increased withdrawals. Experts advise investing in equities for inflation-adjusted returns and maintaining a balanced portfolio even in retirement.

title: MP Diwali tragedy: How viral reels promoted dangerous carbide guns
content: A dangerous Diwali trend involving carbide guns has led to severe eye injuries among children and young adults in Madhya Pradesh. Inspired by social media videos and online DIY guides, many youngsters purchased or even assembled these explosive devices.

title: Satish Shah dies at 74: Understanding kidney failure and its warning signs
content: Veteran actor Satish Shah, celebrated for his comedic brilliance and iconic roles in "Yeh Jo Hai Zindagi" and "Sarabhai vs Sarabhai," has passed away at 74 due to kidney failure. His health rapidly deteriorated after being admitted to Hinduja Hospital. The article also outlines the signs and causes of kidney failure.

title: IND vs AUS: Milestone alert! Rohit breaks Kohli's record, equals Sachin
content: Rohit Sharma's magnificent unbeaten 121 led India to a dominant nine-wicket victory over Australia in Sydney, avoiding a series whitewash.  Sharma's 33rd ODI century, his ninth against Australia, saw him surpass Kohli and equal Tendulkar for most centuries against the Aussies.  A stellar bowling performance restricted Australia, setting the stage for the record-breaking partnership.

title: Kolkata hotel: Foul smell leads to discovery of decomposed body inside bed
content: A family checking into a Kolkata hotel discovered a decomposed body hidden in a storage bed after complaining of a pungent smell. The victim, identified as 26-year-old Rahul Lal, had checked in with two other men who later left. Preliminary reports indicate strangulation as the cause of death.

title: BJP leader Bablu Yadav shot amid Bihar polls
content: A shocking incident has come to light from Bhagalpur amid the Bihar Assembly elections. In the TNB Law College Lane under Barari police station area, BJP leader Vivekanand Prasad alias Bablu Yadav was shot at on Friday, said Bhagalpur DSP Ajay Kumar Chaudhary.

title: 'Hraam... hreem... hruuum': Bengaluru's ‘ghost-chasing’ sorcerer faces police case
content: A Bengaluru sorcerer, Srinivas Swami, faces police action for disturbing neighbours with midnight rituals and loud music. After a complaint, he allegedly cursed a neighbour, threatening her with death. The court has ordered a case registered under the Black Magic Act, with police investigating the threats and alleged assault. Authorities warn against late-night noise and encourage cooperation in such investigations.

title: Huge blow! Shreyas Iyer suffers injury; rushed to hospital
content: India's vice-captain Shreyas Iyer sustained a concerning injury while fielding during the third ODI against Australia. He landed awkwardly after taking a splendid running catch and was taken to the hospital for further assessment. This adds to India's injury concerns on the Australia tour, with other Nitish Kumar Reddy also unavailable.

title: Kash Patel says he decides which arrest to make; Social media trolls him over Epstein
content: FBI Director Kash Patel vehemently denied claims that President Trump orchestrated the NBA gambling bust due to player activism. Patel asserted his sole authority over arrest decisions, dismissing the suggestion as "dumbest thing I've ever heard." Social media users trolled him, saying he couldn't make any arrests in the Epstein or Diddy case whatsoever.

title: Kohli with a cheeky smile; first run of ODI series vs AUS arrives - Watch
content: A simple single run by Virat Kohli at the Sydney Cricket Ground ignited the crowd, offering a spark of relief and amusement after previous low scores.  This moment, celebrated with a standing ovation, underscored his significant connection with the venue and his resilience. Earlier, India's bowlers, led by Harshit Rana, had restricted Australia to 236.

title: Self baggage drop, DigiYatra and more - all about new Terminal 2 at IGI Airport
content: Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu inaugurated the renovated Terminal 2 at Indira Gandhi International Airport, which will resume operations Sunday. The revamped terminal, now boasting a total annual passenger handling capacity exceeding 100 million, features self-baggage drop, six new boarding bridges, and DigiYatra services for enhanced passenger experience.

title: 'Death over returning to RJD': Tej Pratap Yadav says not hungry for power
content: Tej Pratap Yadav has declared he will never rejoin the RJD, prioritizing principles and self-respect over power. Launching his own party, Janshakti Janta Dal, he is contesting from Mahua, his debut constituency. He expressed confidence in his connection with the people of Mahua, dismissing his brother Tejashwi's political ambitions and criticizing Prashant Kishor as a mere 'trader'.

title: 'Captain ka darja': Virat Kohli grabs Shubman Gill's arm - Watch
content: India, trailing 0-2, aimed to salvage pride in the final ODI against Australia. Despite a solid start by the visitors, India's bowlers, guided by the experience of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, restricted Australia to 236. Kohli's on-field interactions with captain Shubman Gill proved crucial in the team's bowling and fielding efforts.

title: UP madrassa sought ‘virginity certificate’ from 13-year-old for admission
content: A Moradabad madrassa official was arrested after a father alleged his 13-year-old daughter was denied admission without a "virginity certificate." The school's admission in-charge and principal reportedly demanded a medical test, abused the student's mother, and took money for a transfer certificate that was never issued. An FIR has been filed under relevant sections of the law.

title: 'Basic civic sense missing': Woman cleans train window but litters on tracks - video
content: A viral video shows a woman cleaning a train window with a tissue and bottle, only to discard them onto the railway tracks. Netizens criticized the act, highlighting the irony of promoting civic sense while demonstrating a lack thereof. The clip has garnered significant attention, underscoring the need for genuine civic responsibility awareness.

title: In Doctor Suicide Case, Father's Death Penalty Appeal To Devendra Fadnavis
content: The father of the 26-year-old doctor who died by suicide in Maharashtra's Satara has sought the death penalty for the culprits responsible for her daughter's death.

title: Chaos, Lathicharge, And A Helmeted MLA: Fertiliser Fury In Madhya Pradesh
content: Madhya Pradesh is witnessing a massive uproar over a fertiliser shortage, with angry farmers clashing with authorities, and even an MLA forced to stand in line for hours in protest.

title: 'Bihar Ka Nayak' Posters On Tejashwi Yadav Prompt BJP's 'Khalnayak' Jibe
content: A fresh political storm erupted in Bihar after posters calling RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav "Bihar ka Nayak" appeared across Patna. The BJP launched a sharp counterattack, accusing Tejashwi and his family of being involved in corruption cases

title: Girls In School Uniform Try To Buy Alcohol, Get It Without A Hitch
content: A video shows girl students in school uniforms buying alcohol from a government liquor shop in Nainpur in Mandla district district of Madhya Pradesh.

title: Nagpur-Delhi Air India Flight Returns After Bird Hit, Passengers Safe
content: An Air India flight from Nagpur to Delhi returned to Nagpur shortly after take-off on October 24 following a bird-hit, an Air India spokesperson said.

title: US, China Had "Very Constructive" Trade Talks Ahead Of Trump-Xi Meet: Official
content: The United States and China conducted "very constructive" trade talks in Malaysia on Saturday, a US Treasury spokesman said, ahead of a highly anticipated meeting of their leaders in South Korea next week.

title: Trump Heads To Asia For Trade Talks With Xi, Kim Jong Un Meeting Possible
content: US President Donald Trump headed for Asia on Saturday and high-stakes trade talks with Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping, saying that he would also like to meet North Korean leader Kim Jong Un on his trip.

title: On Bihar Opposition's Deputy Chief Minister Pick, A Owaisi's Muslim Question
content: In the colourful mosaic of Bihar's political landscape, where the holy Ganges and its tributaries flow with a history of resilience and renewal, and where democratic competition for votes has brought about a social churn.

title: Cough, Headaches: 3 In 4 Delhi-NCR Homes Feeling Air Impact, Finds Survey
content: Three out of four households in Delhi-NCR are already experiencing the ill-effects of toxic air, with common complaints ranging from sore throat and cough to burning eyes, headaches and disturbed sleep, according to an online survey

title: 2 Tribal Minors Gang Raped In Odisha, 3 Suspects In Custody
content: Two tribal girls were allegedly gang-raped by five men in Odisha's Mayurbhanj district when they were returning home along with their friends, police said on Saturday.

title: Andhra On Alert As Cyclone Montha Likely To Cross Kakinada Coast On Tuesday
content: With the India Meteorological Department (IMD) forecasting that Cyclone Montha is likely to cross the coast near Kakinada on October 28, Chief Secretary K Vijayanand has instructed all district collectors and officials to remain on high alert

title: US Singer Mary Millben Calls PM Modi 'Good Friend,' Praises His Leadership
content: American singer and actress Mary Millben, known for her cultural diplomacy, expressed her deep admiration and respect for Prime Minister Narendra Modi, calling him "a good friend" and praising his leadership both in India and on the global stage

title: 13 African Students Among 20 Arrested For Liquor Party In Dry State Gujarat
content: Police raided a farmhouse on the outskirts of Ahmedabad city and arrested 15 persons, including 13 African nationals, for allegedly consuming liquor during a party, and later apprehended five more individuals, an official said on Saturday.

title: Double Suicide In Arunachal Amid Sexual Exploitation, Threat Allegations
content: A 19-year-old man and a senior government official have ended their lives in Arunachal Pradesh, in a sensational case of a double suicide raising allegations of sexual exploitation, manipulation, and threats.

title: High-Level Review Meeting In Bengal Over Women's Safety In Hospitals
content: After back-to-back cases of violence against women in West Bengal hospitals, a high-level review meeting was called at the state secretariat. It was chaired by the Chief Secretary and included the principals of all medical colleges of West Bengal.

title: Dashcam Video Captures Narrow Escape On Bengaluru-Hyderabad Highway
content: A terrifying dashcam video shared on social media has fuelled a heated debate over highway safety and reckless driving after it showed a driver narrowly avoiding a potentially fatal collision with a truck on the Bengaluru-Hyderabad highway.

title: 20 Injured As Bus Overturns In Telangana, Day After Kurnool Accident
content: A day after 20 people died when a luxury bus caught fire in Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool district, a private bus overturned while travelling from Hyderabad to Guntur in Andhra Pradesh on Saturday.

title: "I Will Die": Indian Man, Out In Saudi Desert With A Camel, Asks PM For Help
content: A video plea from an Indian worker allegedly trapped in Saudi Arabia has gone viral on social media, prompting diplomatic interv

title: "This Government Doesn't Hide Reports": Delhi Minister To AAP On Yamuna Revival
content: Delhi's political temperature soared on Saturday after the Delhi Pollution Control Committee reported worsening water quality in the Yamuna, just ahead of Chhath Puja, when thousands of devotees are expected to take a holy dip.

title: Haryana Court Rejects Bail Plea Of YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra In Espionage Case
content: A court in Haryana's Hisar district has dismissed the bail plea of YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra, who was arrested in May on the suspicion of espionage, and said there is a reasonable apprehension that her release on bail may impede the probe.

content: the FIA handed Red Bull a €50,000 fine at the u.s. grand prix . a mechanic tried to re-enter the grid once the formationI lap had started to remove tape . the mechanics used tape on the pit wall as a visual aid to ensure his car was not too far forward .

title: Woman killed, four others injured in an explosion  owing to LPG cylinder leakage
content: an 81-year-old woman was killed and four others sustained injuries after a suspected LPG cylinder explosion at their home in KR Puram, Bengaluru . e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective .

title: Round 1 preview, predictions: Can anyone stop Philly?
content: the 2025 MLS Cup playoffs kicked off on Wednesday with the wild card round, which saw the ninth seeds from both the East and West get knocked out . this phase of the postseason moves quickly, with the dust on Wednesday's Wild Card games having barely settled before inter Miami and Nashville SC get Round 1 underway on Friday night . the 'futbol Americas' crew debate who's the leading contenders to win the MLS cup .

title: UConn reveals championship rings designed by Bueckers, Fudd and Ducharme
content: the men's basketball team held a private event to receive their championship rings from their 2025 NCAA national championship run . they defeated south Carolina 82-59 in the title game, anchored by Sarah Strong's 24 points, 15 rebounds and five assists . the rings are filled with detail that represents the title won, as well as trace of team identity and tradition .

title: 12 more NFL Week 8 games: We have predictions, picks and wild stats

title: Premier League live updates: Sunderland level at Chelsea
content: We're back with another action-packed weekend of football across Europe! In the  Premier League ,  Chelsea  take on  Sunderland  with a view to going second, while struggling  Newcastle United  and  Fulham  are battling at the other end of the table. Later,  Manchester United  will be aiming to extend their two-game winning streak against  Brighton & Hove Albion , and  Liverpool  host  Brentford  hoping to bounce back in the league after a commanding performance in the UEFA Champions League in midweek. In Europe,  Bayern Munich  will look to extend their unbeaten run in all competitions as they face  Borussia Mönchengladbach  in the  Bundesliga , and in Italy, a massive  Serie A  showdown awaits as  Napoli  take on  Internazionale  in a clash between two sides battling for the title. Stay tuned for live updates.
